We were very pleased to walk straight into the lounge with only one or two other people there when the line up to get into the normal restaurant for breakfast was very long. Our room was fabulous, and even though it was obviously a little older, it was spotless and roomy and well appointed. We appreciated the robes and slippers and the nice big deep bath and the lovely view over Orchard Road. The staff were without exception excellent and looked after every little need we had. The staff in the executive lounge in particular were exceptional. The comments about the shopping centre below the hotel are fair. It's a bit sleazy looking and it makes for an awkward entry and exit. But this didn't detract from the hotel in our view. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. We enjoyed our stay immensely.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but nothing more”
Reviews.Author: Aliceandeve
Reviews.Content: We chose the concorde because of its location and in the end this is the best thing in its favour. The rooms are ok but not at all exciting and the whole place has a general conference center type feel. On the plus side the breakfast was good and staff were efficient

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: maria5714
Reviews.Content: Arriving close to midnight, Singapore time, it was wonderful to find spacious rooms with very comfortable beds & pillows. The best surprise we discovered that morning when we stepped outside and saw how close we were to the amazing shopping district on Orchard Rd. It was obvious the rooms were newly renovated because there was still paint on the stone benchtops in the bathroom, which I managed to scrape off with my nail! We found the Singapore taxi drivers to be excellent and very knowledgeable. They provided us with more information than the hotel lobby staff. We had a wonderful time and would have no hesitation staying in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gellin_Uppsala
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on this hotel - half price compare to average and stayed two nights. Top first class hotel with everything you could ask for. Fantastic decorations, rooms are huge, the breakfast is something you will remeber for years. The only minus for this great palce would be the "stiff" attitude from some of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing...”
Reviews.Author: mand2020
Reviews.Content: As this was my first tyime back in Singapore for nearly 17 years I was looking forward to showing my daughter the beautiful city that it is and ensured we stayed in a hotel well located and serviced. Well located yes but unfortuneately the room in the hotel let us down big time. We checked in late after a late evening flight into our Premier Club room on the top floor. When we entered the room with tired child in tow we found that there were 2 single beds. I rang the front desk and asked where they expected my daughter to sleep (i was willing to accept the two single beds for my husband and i) i was advised that we had booked a twin room and therefore the two single beds. As my secretary had made the booking i was willing to sort of accept this mistake, however it was clear in our booking details that there were 2 adults and 1 child.......again i asked where my daughter was expected to sleep, the response was well we can send up another bed but that will be $50US per night extra....WHAT!!! 3 people were booked into the room at the advertised rate and only 2 beds were provided!!! After much discussion regarding the extra bed...I asked for a fourth time (after refusing to pay extra for the bed) where was i supposed to put my daughter to bed at which point i received the curt reply "wherever you want to". I hung up rather upset with my 8 year old falling asleep in the chair at 1.00am. Ended up puching beds closer together and my daughter slept in the crack inbetween!!! Also agree the hotel is tired and old with some strange smells and sounds....I am sure there are much better hotels in singapore for the same price that i will definitely try on my next visit..

Reviews.Title: “Poor Quality Room”
Reviews.Author: boucle
Reviews.Content: On November 20, I checked in at about 9.30 in the morning. At that time, the reception said that the room was not ready. So we said, it's okay we can come back after breakfast. but the lady said a room was ready on the 4th floor (the side facing the hotel grand central). The room was poor, old style. And most annoying is the strong smoke odor. The clean lady gave fragrance spray, but the smell is still strong. We then called to the reception, ask for room change, to a better room. They said, it will be possible. However, the second room (4th floor, facing Orchard road, the east wing) was worse! The smell was like damped and wet cloth, humid. It might be from the old carpet they have. The smell is intolerant. Another clean lady said that they will put like an air-refresher machine for half an hour and the smell will be gone. We gave it a try. When we came back after a walk at about 3pm. The smell was still there. Nothing changes. So we called in to the reception again to ask for a room change, or at least air refresher with fragrance. After calling again and again, and waiting for 30 minutes, a Chinese lady who can not speak English came to the room and spray here and there. But of course it doesn't affect anything. To add on that, the attitude of the reception staff were not helpful and instead disrespectful in attending to our request just for a decent room. After the complain, all they care is just sending a housekeeping who can't even speak English, so we couldn't even communicate there. The reception say it's not their job to go to the room and to see how the room is not proper. We called to the reception, ask for room change. They said the room was full. I told them the room just opposite us is empty. And they say, it's booked and all the reasons. She said she will get a room for us. And I told them we could wait till 7pm, before we are going out for dinner. We wait, wait, and wait. No news, very professional. it's just when we came back from dinner, at about 9.30 pm there is a message saying that there's a room available for us. It's 12 hours after we checked in and they have a (may-be) proper room! I directly called them saying that it's too late for a change already. At about 10.30 pm there still a paper message slipped to our room saying that there's a room available (timed 9.32pm). It shows lack of coordination internal the hotel. Also, they said there will be concierge helping us with our luggage from the first to the second room. We waited for 15 minutes, and ended up with dragging by ourselves all our luggage. So that's how Concorde has been successful in making us very disappointed. It's a waste of time and money on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: maddie20
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with superb service. Great location too on Orchard Rd. Breakfasts were lovely and dining staff extremely friendly. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but waited hours for room.”
Reviews.Author: sushisurprise
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 14.00 and had to wait 2 hours before our rooms were ready. Hotel's excuse was that the incumbents were late in checking out! My opinion is that the hotel is short-staffed, because the following days we noted that our rooms were not cleaned until four or five in the afternoon. Hotel facilities are OK, staff friendly and helpful, but the initial wait marred our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommendable”
Reviews.Author: euribe
Reviews.Content: This is the weirdest hotel I have stayed. To start, the van that picked me up at the airport had to left me in the basement as only small cars can go through the front of the hotel. The elevators that took me to the 2nd floor (front desk) were dirty. After check in, they assigned me a room in the second floor. Carpet was dirty, no view, bathroom was not pleasant. I only stayed for 2 nights so it was too short to ask for a better room. Location is OK, and surroundings fine, but the building old. However I later understood most hotels in Singapore are similar. This is an expensive city and hotels are also expensive. You can have internet in the room, also very expensive: close to $23 USD per 24 hrs.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel very near to attractions...”
Reviews.Author: justbegantotravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Concorde 2 nights between 15/17 November 2010. We arrived very early so the room was not ready but we returned back at 14:00 and checked in smoothly. We booked a Singaporeair Stop over holiday so the room was superior type which means a little bit old and basic. However it was ok, however there was a construction at the hotel just above our floor and was very noisy that we couldn't slept. After couple of telephone conversations, we requested our room to be changed and this request is easily accepted by the Manager. However we were upgraded to an Executive room to apologize for the situation. This room was very big, new and very nicely decorated with LCD, DVD player, a balcony.... We have never eat at the hotel so don't know the quality. The entrance to hotel is a little bit strange, you have to pass through a small average mall but it was OK for us. However taxi access is available from the reception area. By the way taxis are very cheap here in Singapore, we used alot. Overall there is construct on the 3rd floor of the hotel so I recommend you to request a room from either 1st floor or 4th floor. However it is a very nice hotel, staff was very polite and helpfull. The location was also very good being on Orchrad road. I recommend Concorde Hotel to anyone that wants a good value for the money, at an easy to reach location and with a friendly staff service. I will stay there again if I go to Singapore without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kaminski
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and left feeling that I couldn't find a better hotel at the price I paid for in Singapore. I wont hesitate to stay here again in the future and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Value”
Reviews.Author: sweets61250
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel at a very very very special rate for a Premier Suite with Club Benefits included (Breakfast / Evening Cocktails / Internet). KUDUS to the hotel for honoring the rate and all benefits. The room was not actually a 2 room suite but a large room. It was quite nice and newly renovated with a curtain around the bed. Had breakfast in the Lounge as well as the restaurant. Both were nice with more selection in their restaurant. Location is at 1 end of Orchard road, not as good as the Marriott or the Manderin or the Hilton but not bad. Close to the MRT Dhoby Ghaut. Overall very very happy with the stay

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel -Location on Orchard Rd - great shopping and nite life”
Reviews.Author: abidad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Concorde hotel for 2 nites there were 3 adults, the room was big to accommodate all of us with a king-size bed and a roll away Breakfast was a buffet which was lovely from local foods Naan, Noodle soups, to pancakes and waffles the price was reasonable as every meal was discount by 50% Hotel has a wonderful outside pool great for swimming and the staffs was very friendly and gave good advice for shopping in other areas The hotel is located on top of the mall there is a food court on the first floor or straight outside the hotel there is more food stalls very cheap and shopping on the second floor of the hotel The hotel lobby is located on the 3rd floor and our room was on the fourth surprisingly for such a busy street we could not hear any outside noise, very peaceful atmosphere is well recommended

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service and great location.”
Reviews.Author: Dieseldust
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Concorde for 5 nights. Booked some months ago through there early bird booking rates and received excellent deals. We booked a premiere suite and rooms were terrific. I will agree that some sections of the hotel are getting a little outdated but staff service and hospitality was superb. The premiere lounge is worth updating to as you receive alternate breakfast options, free net and free happy hour drinks (2 hours). Yes I would definitely recommend the concorde.

Reviews.Title: “Location is perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Penguinmoon
Reviews.Content: Booked an amazing rate for a Premiere suite at the hotel online. About a week before arrival, I received an email from the booking agent that the rate was so amazing, many of the benefits that were included in the package would not be extended. Needless to say, I was very disappointed, and many emails went back and forth, to no avail on my part. Arrived at the hotel, and was treated very well. I guess the hotel decided to include all that was included after all. Kudos to the management and staff at the hotel for handling a potential problem well; they now will have a repeat customer, who will speak very highly of them. The hotel is perfectly located on Orchard, very close to MRT and bus lines. The Premiere Suite has recently been refurnished, and still looks new. The suites is not what I would call a suite, resembling a large hotel room instead. I had breakfast a two different venues, the Premiere Lounge, and the Spice restaurant. The private lounge was much more intimate and quiet, Spice had a much better selection. However, both very good. Pool area and gym both good; very user friendly. All amenities measured up to four star standards. Most staff encountered were very friendly . Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: headspinning
Reviews.Content: My husband, 11 yr old son and I stayed at the Concorde Hotel for 5 nights in late September. Our room was a deluxe and although it looked a "bit tired" in comparison to the rest of the hotel which has been refurbished there was nothing wrong with our room. Breakfast was good with a reasonable choice. Location was great - a couple of minute walk to Dhoby Ghaut MRT was very convenient for us. Proximity to fantastic restaurants in Cuppage Lane another plus. Overall I would be happy to stay at the Concorde again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NichollsFamily_10
Reviews.Content: Concorde is in a great location and has all the amenities you need. Room was clean and big. We had a suite as there were 4 of us which meant we had access to the lounge providing breakfast and cocktails. Children loved the pool and ping pong table Staff were helpful although concierge could have been better. Would definitely recommend

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ArieLu
Reviews.Content: We have been here with an offer through expedia because, as every hotel in Singapore, proces are very high for good hotels. When you arrive walking at the hotel you mustn't be discouraged by the "strange entrance". The only possibility is to pass through a little market taking a stair and one elevator to arrive at the lobby (by taxy you arrive directly, but subway is very close and efficient). Lobby is very nice, we had premier room and premier lounge to give us special services as free internet, dedicated breakfast, free drinks etc. Rooms (last floor for us) are very large, renovated and nice. Breakfast good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: cavamebri
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here - location was fantastic - close to shops and MRT. Very comfortable and very quiet. The pool area could use a bit sprucing up and the breakfast was very expensive for a family

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located hotel I enjoyed my stay here”
Reviews.Author: FMBHamilton
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed a brief stay at the Concorde Singapore for one night in June 2010. The hotel is in a great location on Orchard Road. The room was clean and well appointed and quiet and I was upgraded to a superior room for no extra cost. I ate in the restaurant for dinner - there was a seafood buffet which was really good and very cheap and even include lobster. The only downside to this hotel is that I was dropped off in an underground car park and had to make my own way up to reception. Apparently the slip road up to the hotel is not wide enough to take minibuses or anything larger than a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Concorde Hotel - A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jbpapp
Reviews.Content: As part of our singapore airlines stop over we stayed at the Concorde Hotel. This hotel is centrally located in Orchard Street, has friendly and professional staff and offers comfortable, clean and modern accommodation. In our experience of this hotel we felt welcomed and were treated with respect and offered individual attention. Our room was upgraded 2 levels. Breakfast was excellent. Any requests or questions we had were answered promptly. Some other reviews are critical of the entry to this hotel but this posed no problems for us. Simply having to walk through a small shopping centre really isn't any reason to moan. Enjoy your stay in Singapore at this excellent 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, amazingly quiet, on Orchard road”
Reviews.Author: diggerdave
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel for location and amenities. Very confortable room/beds. WE looked out over the tretops across Orchard to the park. It was like we were miles away from the hustle and bustle below. Fabulous Breakfast. It would be nice if the hotel had an enterance from Orchard that matched it's ambience. We will use this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast beyond expectation!”
Reviews.Author: debkpropminster
Reviews.Content: The hotel outlook is really outdated. There is an old fashion mall under the hotel. The mall is not selling international brands but only some local products. Plenty of massage service is found in the mall as well. However, if you neglect the outlook and the mall, the hotel was fantastic. Yes, the room decor is old, but it is comfortable. The breakfast exceeds my expectation and this is one of the best memory I've got during this trip!. The food is marvellous with plenty of traditional Singapore breakfast items. The decor is "good old days" however I like it! Next tirp to Singapore, I will still pick Concorde!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel..Recommended in a good location”
Reviews.Author: The_Rottweiler
Reviews.Content: Got a standard room on arrival in Changi and was surprised this hotel was now a Concorde Hotel. Used to be Le Meridian for many many years. Hotel hasn't changed much but the rooms were comfortable and up to my expectations for the single night I was staying there (no breakfast included in my package) and nearby to where I needed to walk to. The great thing about this hotel is the half dozen massage/reflexology centers on level 1 of the hotel and a couple of pubs to hang out at to watch world cup match's. Walking distance to Dhoby Ghaunt MRT station which made my departure to the airport extremely easy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice One”
Reviews.Author: PK36
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Lobby is Grand and spacious. The Front Desk Staff too is very friendly. The Rooms are very common like any other hotel with all the basic amenities present. It is not like you go to Singapore and first thing you remember is the hotel room. The restaurant has variety of dishes but the food is quite costly. There are quite a few Indians in the staff who r native Singaporeans now and cannot understand Hindi much.Nevertheless staff is very helpfull. Overall the stay is made pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Book Months Early for Best Deals”
Reviews.Author: itchfoot
Reviews.Content: I really liked my Room 501 - being a corner room & away from the lobby but on the sunny side. Got lost a few times at first trying to find my way out of the hotel (could've used a good hotel map!). Decent pool (quite unused) & gym (a little dark). Convenient restaurant in the lobby but more expensive than the FoodCourt (local cuisine) in the basement. Very convenient location on Orchard Road - cross the street to the MRT station 10 minutes stroll away.

Reviews.Title: “Getting Better all the time”
Reviews.Author: AussieGaijin
Reviews.Content: From the old days of the Le Meridien to what it is today, the Concorde on Orchard Road has received significant upgrading. I always find the staff here friendly and courteous and the property is greatly improved after renovation. The hardest part is making sure the taxi drivers know how to access the funny entrance, but other than that, its a very comfortable 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good location, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: travelhappyMumbai
Reviews.Content: This is a very conveniently located hotel, just off Orchard street, if you are interested in shopping, this is a very convenient location. Close to all business places too. Walking distance to most places. The hotel is very clean, decent sized room. The airconditioning was a little noisy though. Over very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Redskins70
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location. Immediately upon walking out of the hotel you are right on Orchard Rd, with malls, restaurants, bars etc. I personally wasn't at all bothered by the fact that you need to exit the hotel via a mall on the ground floor, who cares? I had a renovated room, which was nice and seemed to have all new fixtures except the toilet. Boy was that dated and old. My biggest gripe was the daily charge for internet access - $35 a night?! Really?! Total rip off. This mainly seems to be a business hotel. A lof of local companies were using the meeting rooms for workshops and trainings. The gym was good. Overall, service was good, nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Good premier room experience”
Reviews.Author: tokay96
Reviews.Content: I've read other reviews before staying there. This hotel has 2 entry point, the first one is main entrance (if you come by taxi), the other is from the old shopping centre (it's not impressive at all to go through the mall)...so , just make sure you come from the main entrance..it's big and elegant. Booked from the hotel's web, there's a promo in premier room with very affordable rate. Location is good....and it's safe for solo woman to get back to the lobby through the shopping centre. The room was spacious, clean, with large working table. Electric plug is available for your charger. Large flat screen TV, DVD player. Iron&iron bar, safe box. Soap, shampoo, body lotion, bath salt, hair dryer, shower all was good. Bed is verrry comfy !! The Japanese staff in premier lounge was verrrry friendly, though I think there should be 2 persons standby there....I waited 20 minutes for check out...lucky I didn;t get late for my flight. (they also had premier express check-out counter but nobody's there!!!) The premier lounge is OK....free internet with 2 computers available for premier guests. The snacks and cocktails were good. Breakfast is 4-star standard. I would stay there again !

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lalyfan22
Reviews.Content: I had one of the most extraordinary nights of my life . fabulous place and great service. Breakfast is so soI Staff was helpful. I cant wait to visit again .

Reviews.Title: “A Horrible end to a perfect Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: PamandJeff
Reviews.Content: "Over Priced for what you get". Our experience with the concord hotel and staff was not a pleasent one, we were not greeted warmly but extremley rudely pointed to our room! when opening the the door to our room we were horrified to see that the room we where issued was not like any of the photos we have seen! it was old and worn in, the room was not well cleaned at all and our luggage dumped on the floor in front of the door! There was no milk in the room and only one sachet of coffee for the two nights we stayed there. phone calls and messages left from our tour guide where not passed on to us even though we where sitting right in front of the reception desk, and lead us to miss our night zoo tour that was already booked and paid for! The only good thing about the Concorde hotel was that it is in a great location. I would not recommend anyone to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: fairywings2507
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located centrally on Orchard Road, with the MRT close by. Was a little difficult to find, but only because of a lack of numbers on the buildings. The room could have been a bit cleaner, particularly the bathroom. The hotel was a bit smelly, but I think that is because of the humidity. All the staff were very friendly. Breakfast was excellent with a wide range to choose from. A bit of a problem with the bill whereby they tried to charge us full price, when we booked 45 days in advance. Lucky we checked. Fortunately we had a copy of our booking and this was sorted out.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: Anshy
Reviews.Content: Hi, I stayed at the hotel for more than 3 days and it was wonderful experience. The best part was the location of the hotel. Orchard road is the most famous road in singapore and in addition to that, there was a food court in the basement of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT LOCATION & STAFF”
Reviews.Author: ExeterUKMagoo
Reviews.Content: Best location for everything in Singapore - walkable to all shops on Orchard Road and only 200 metres to MST for everywhere else. Room was excellent and staff could not ne more helpful - we had late check out till 12 but we were able to keep the room till 3pm and then they gave us a room to freshen up in later. They even supplied a wheelchair for my father for the whole 4 days we were there at no charge at all. Breakfast buffet was brilliant loads of choice with again friendly staff. Walking through the Shopping Mall to get into the Hotel was unusual but no problem at all

Reviews.Title: “TOP Service experienced”
Reviews.Author: Thom-Tom
Reviews.Content: Well located hotel. The highlight of our stay was Makiko the receptionist who checked us in and out. I was even surprised on checkout when I was presented with a birthday cake in the premuim lounge along with some cocktails. Her good attention to detail meant she noted my date of birth during check in. The hotel was quiet and private.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DrErik
Reviews.Content: I got a good service from Concorde Hotel Singapore. The room is clean and the location perfect. It's only about 20 Sin$ from the airport with Taxi or 3 Sin$ with MRT (Dhoby Gout). The hotel and the mall (especially food court) in the one area. You can eat healthy food in Korean Restaurant (Kim Dae Mon).

Reviews.Title: “A tad expensive for the rooms but service was better than average”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi8888
Reviews.Content: We booked very last minute for this hotel and this was one of the few people recommended at the budget we wanted to spend. To be honest the basic rooms were average and were not worth 250 SG$ we paid. However after we asked for a change we got upgraded to a premier room. That was very nice of them and I did appreciate the service on offer. Room service, concierge, front desk, and waiter staff were generally excellent, in fact there are a number of the Concorde team who were just outstanding and helped us above and beyond the call of duty! (Unfortunately they were not all like that) The breakfast was adequate without being over the top and if you really want a decent pool this one is probably not going to be the one you go to (it needs a cleaning). Also the person who was the waiter at the pool was annoyingly pushy with trying to sell EVERYONE drinks again and again and again! Overall I would say that the fantastic staff we met almost made up for all the other downsides.

Reviews.Title: “Less than Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FarangBangkok
Reviews.Content: Booked for 3 nights but on arrival their record was for 2 only, quickly sorted out. Attitude of check in / out staff bordering on rude, no please or thank you at all. Rooms OK but needs refurbishment and are noisy.The hotel is old and outdated. Hotel location good . Very disappointed in the stay here

Reviews.Title: “Service was poor”
Reviews.Author: Destichado
Reviews.Content: The hotel has excellent facilities, touch screen info screen in the spacious lobby, great, wide room with comfy bed and all, however througout my four interactions with the reception staff I was surprised with the attitude, which although not rude, were cold and not welcoming. Their training should include the point that the reason why travelers still prefer not to check-in automacially with robots is the human interaction. All other was fine and up to the standards of a four star property.

Reviews.Title: “As Expected”
Reviews.Author: PDaddyW
Reviews.Content: Despite its an old building hotel, but its well maintained, and I got the new refurbish room complete with LCD TV. Location is right on the corner of Orchard, very good if shopping is your business, many choices of dining experiences, and there is a massage parlor down at hotel shopping arcade. For SGD 180 per night including complete buffet breakfast and Comfy room, I think Its very good bargain....

Reviews.Title: “Dirty bathroom and un-renovated room”
Reviews.Author: SSR-RI
Reviews.Content: Besides the old tired rooms with their outdated bathroom fixtures and dirty rugs, the hotel doesn't have much else to recommend it. Its huge, noisy, and crowded, like being on a cruise ship. I avoided being in the hotel as much as possible , and won't go back. There are way better places to stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “It was an excellent choice for a business trip with a little shopping on trhe side.”
Reviews.Author: valmun
Reviews.Content: The package for an Executive Floor room sans the usual amenities was great value-fcor-money. The location was excellent for both my business meetings and some shopping after work. The buffet breakfast service at the Cafe was good despite the full house.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: HuaHinGovernor
Reviews.Content: Having booked this hotel for location and price we were a little concerned when we read some negative comments, but our concerns were soon put to rest and we enjoyed the hotel very much. We arrived via the shopping centre having travelled from the airport via the MRT, the journey was about 30 mins and cost a tad under S$2, there was a musty smell on arrival, but that was the shopping centre and not the hotel. Still a bit concerned as the shopping centre was to say the least dated as was the lift, but we liked the hotel foyer very much, yes it was a tad dated but you could say art decor. Despite some other reports the staff on reception were very friendly, we had booked a Premier Room so we were ushered into the Premier Lounge where we were checked in, in a very friendly and efficient manner. Our room, which was a refurbished one, was very large and nice it even had a separate office, not that we needed it. As we had booked the Premier Room, which didn't cost very much more that the standard room, we took advantage of the cocktail hour, well two hours actually, enjoying free drinks and canapes. The free breakfast could be taken in the restaurant, the lounge or even as room service, we chose the lounge and it was an excellent choice. I would certainly stay in this hotel again, the value and location were second to none, and our experience was first class. When going back to the airport we took a chance and decided to try the 36 bus, which stops right outside the front door of the hotel. It was a very enjoyable ride, took 45 mins to the Airport and only cost S$1, though probably not a good idea if you have too much luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and exactly what we needed.”
Reviews.Author: ozmusoadel
Reviews.Content: The only problem with the decor of this hotel is the fact that it's a little dated. But if you're on holiday you just need a clean, comfortable and convenient place to stay. The Concorde was all these things. From reception to check out the service was deadpan and dour. It wasn't the sort of fawning-but-faux interest one gets in North America, but neither was it the downright rudeness one often encounters in Europe. That's Singapore: efficient, get it done, next... The room was excellent, quiet (even though it overlooked Orchard Rd) and comfortable. Bathroom fine. The buffet breakfast was extensive and available 0630-1030, which was longer than other places I've stayed. The hotel is very close to the MRT (Dhoby Ghaut) and taxis were easy to get from the front door, despite the fact that the lobby is on the third floor and removed from the street (taxis know where it is and it's well signposted from the street anyway). The "shopping mall" on the first two floors leaves a lot to be desired. There's a great shoe shop on the second floor but the constant haranguing for a massage every time we walked past got very boring. No matter, it's all right on one end of Orchard Rd so if you need to shop, this is the place to stay. There's a FANTASTIC little set of hawker stalls on the corner right next to the hotel. The satay at midnight on the night we arrived was heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Honest Review - Don't stay there”
Reviews.Author: tamluc
Reviews.Content: This is the worst place I have ever stayed in all my years of travel and I am a traveller that does not have high expectations. I made 2 bookings as a friend also decided to meet our travel party in Singapore for a few days, the hotel in their wisdom decided I made and error in bookings and did not process the second booking instead of contacting me to confirm, this made it very difficult as the extra person arrived a few hours before us to have no room resevation and they wanted to put my 73 year old mother on a different floor to us even though we requested rooms next to each other and as it was she was 10 rooms down the corridor. The rooms are small, tired, dark, you get noise from the rooms each side of you plus from the other rooms on the other side of the corridor. This is definitely not good value for money. The bathrooms have no seperate shower which means you have to climb into the bath for a shower and there is no hand rail to hold onto which made things difficult for my elderly mother. There was mould in the bathroom. The only good thing about this hotel is it has a safe & it worked and the location. The only friendlyness we got from this place is from the cleaning staff & from 1 conceirge to arrange our taxi on checking out. We had a late check out of 6pm and in speaking to reception on the day we left we were told check out is 3pm so I produced our booking documents and he was not happy or apologetic, I said to him we will be checking out at 6pm. At 4.45pm we had a do not disturb sign on our door and a staff member took no notice of this and was knocking on our door asking when are we going to check out. I have stayed in better 3* hotels in 3rd world countries and better 2-3* in Singapore before. Will never return to this hotel again..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Dreamer23
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. We travel quite often and always stay a few days in Singapore to break our trip. We were very impressedn with the Concorde.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Tarkyone
Reviews.Content: i would not recommend this hotel. It is very tired and not good value for money. We could hear every noise from reception in our room, the tv remotes in both rooms did not work. It was pure and simple very very average.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad, really”
Reviews.Author: MrLuv2Travel
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews regarding the noise and pedestrian entrance to the hotel, but I personally think it was way overblown. This is downtown along the busy Orchard Rd., so do expect some noise. However, if it's really a concern, then just request a quiet room upon making your booking like I did, and all will be just fine. Regarding the entrance to the lobby for pedestrians. Yes, it can be a bit strange to be walking past the karaoke bars and massage outlets, but it's not as dodgy as some make it sound as everyone is very friendly. I did get to peek into other rooms, and noticed that mine was one of the ones that hadn't been renovated yet, but it's still all good. The room was a little dated in its decor, but spacious, comfortable, and clean. And at the bargain deal I got on my room, I really can't complain. The best part however, is the location. There are excellent malls and restaurants very nearby so you really don't need to be in the heart of it. For eats, there's the top floor food court at the 313 mall across the road, or an abundance of other types of restaurants to satisfy your gastronomic desires....just a bit expensive, which is expected for anything along Orchard Rd. However, if you're on a budget, you can save by eating really really cheaply at the Singtel building food court just a stones throw away....where on earth can you still get a bowl of noodles for less than S$2.50 anywhere near Orchard Rd. these days?!.....Yea,the Singtel food court!!!...Just make sure you go before 11.30am to beat the office crowd! Too bad it's only open at lunch times though. There were times when I just wanted to get a light dinner at the hotel's main restaurant, but there was always a long line, or I overheard the host asking if the guest had a reservation? I guess this was Christmas time and people were packing in for the holiday buffets. Hopefully it's not like this all year round. I ended up eating at the hotel's Japanese restaurant, which wasn't bad, just quite pricey. The other convenient thing about being so close to the 313 mall is that the Somerset MRT is located at the back, which you can access through the mall too. So getting anywhere is a breeze. The gym was pretty good sized and well equipped, although the equipment's a bit dated, it's all useable for a good work out. The pool was nice, peaceful, and a good size for decent swimming and tanning. The only gripe I may have is that the daily internet rates are a bit high at S$0.85 an hour or a maxumum of S$24 a day. Thank goodness I happened to venture into the new Mandarin Gallery mall at the Meritus Mandarin Hotel close by. It's a nice cozy mall with nice shops, comfortable public sitting areas, AND with actual no password required FREE wifi!!! However, I'm not sure if this is temporary till the whole mall is fully operational though. I would definitely come back to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located , Rest is manageable”
Reviews.Author: kum28
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is well located for the price. We are provided with a good room with new upholstery and linery. Commuting to and from the hotel was easy with all facilities around it Though the Hotel has an awkward entrace through a mall it is not too bad to be worried about. The BReakfast room was always ovdercrowded with 10-15 minuted waiting which was a dampener at times. Service was good and stay was nice. Food can be better.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location”
Reviews.Author: JustMeAlex
Reviews.Content: Our visit to Singapore on the whole was a wonderful experience. We chose Concorde hotel after some readings on the net which was a great choice. The driver took us to the lower parking area in the hotel which meant I had to take the lift up to the lobby to call the concierge down to help my husband with our luggage. If you take a cab from the airport make sure they take you to the front entrance on Orchard road. Check-in was smooth and quick. Concierge very helpful and so were front desk staff. They upgraded us to the executive floor which was nice but the moment we walked into our room my husband found a huge cocroache, which was very unfortunate!! Staff were very curteous and found us another room, although after going back and forth for a while between rooms! After that incidence everything else was fine. Our stay was great. Our room was spacious, furnitre modern, clean and bed very comfortable. And ofcourse the location of this hotel is unbeatable! You are right on Orchard road which is very convenient for shopping and you're close to two bus/hop-on stations which was also perfect. The entrance to the hotel is from a shopping mall, which was a bit strange but fine. You go into the shopping mall, take a lift up to the lobby and then another one to your room. The second lift works only if you have a room key for security reasons. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in the hotel and in Singapore as a whole!! It is one of those countries that one has to visit at least once..... beautiful! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: say2arun
Reviews.Content: i had one of the most extraordinary nights of my life . fabulous place and great service. I cant wait to visit again !!

Reviews.Title: “glad to have stayed at the concorde”
Reviews.Author: cowan23
Reviews.Content: I arrived 02 November at around 1:30pm was greeted by a very friendly staff , check-in took less than 5 mins , I was in my room after 10 mins. to my surprise my room ( standard accomodation ) was very spacious, a lot bigger than other hotels that i've stayed previously, internet connection was very reasonably priced. since lower areas is a shopping mall food was no problem , there was a food court at the bottom and a hawkers place at the side of the hotel. location was great since it is along the orchard road bigger shopping malls are mere walking distance ( 5 mins walk ). the hotel is undergoing renovations but due to careful planning you hardly notice that is was being renovated. on my third day I had some concerns regarding the smell of paint in my room , the assistant manager Hassim ,acted on my concern right away and within 5 minutes after we have talked , housekeeping installed an ionizer on my room to eliminate the smell of paint , from that time on until my check out on 07 November the room no longer had any problems. If i had to make a suggestion , it would be best to change the breakfast buffet menu every day since to be quite honest the first 2 days i was looking forward to breakfast, however on the 3rd day onwards, i dread breakfast since im quite sure that the food served will be the same as day 1. as a whole the stay at the concorde was a great experience , and i'm greatfull to the managemnet and staff for giving me a wonderful experience . I'm looking forward to my next Singapore trip and would deffinitely recommend this hotel to friends . brgds, R. C. S. Cruz philippines

Reviews.Title: “Great spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: shaz2382
Reviews.Content: Great hotel , very nice staff and spacious rooms. Breakfast was fabulous with plenty of variety. Room service was great for the time confused traveller and very cheap. Access was a bit different with steps or lift access to Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not a top quality hotel on Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: dkmr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Concorde hotel for 3 nights. Apparently, it was recently a Le Meridien because not all of my colleagues in Singapore or taxi drivers knew it by the Concorde name. It's right on Orchard Road, so the location is very convenient for shopping. There's a large food court on the lower level with a multitude of stalls serving all types of Asian food. There's also a smaller set of food stalls just outside. Some of the inside and outdoor stalls were great. A quirk of this hotel is that room service has an extremely limited menu (they call it something like TV snacks). All items we tried were delicious, but there wasn't much choice. The hotel is being renovated, I think from the top floors down. We were on the sixth floor and during ehe day could hear construction on the seventh floor above us - not too annoying, and it started late and ended early. The lower floors are in need of renovation to make it really first rate. Check to see if you'll get a renovated room before booking there. The hotel was very helpful in arranging drivers to and from the airport and taxis to anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “thankyou for the great experience”
Reviews.Author: Monkeys1
Reviews.Content: booked a standard room through travel agent in melbourne , arrived and decided to upgrade to a premiere club room. This was the best $300AUD we have spent over 5 days. Rooms were very clean , Premiere club has its own breakfast room with great staff (Augustine, Suki,chef steven) , thankyou for an experience of the best srvice we have had in a hotel stay in some time. The entrance to the hotel might not be flashy , but if you have been to several hotels in singapore the location smack bang in the middle of ORCHARD RD is probably the best.. Within walking distance to some fabulous shopping precincts, restaurants, Try the hawkers market outside the hotel ,,,,Wonderfull. The SAEX DIrect bus to the zoo ,Jurong Bird Park, Night Safari Just at the back of the hotel. How much more convenience do you need. To the Staff at the hotel , thankyou for looking after us nad our eight year old with such great care..RECOMEND THE UPGRADE VERY WORTH IT.. See You all soon. WELL be back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Maffradasher
Reviews.Content: This hotel is currently undergoing renovation although this did not take away any enjoyment of our stay. The staff are wonderful and go out of their way to assist you with whatever you require. I would recommend taking the Premier Club option. This entitles you to use the internet free of charge, the Premier Club Lounge, which offers a quiet place have a cuppa and a snack anytime as well as partake of cocktail drinks and refreshments in the early evening (free of charge as it's included in the cost of a Premier Club room) . The location is perfect, right smack bang in the middle of Orchard Road. The lobby is superb and the rooms that have been renovated are as good as any upmarket hotel. Definitely value for money and I will stay there again when I go back to lovely Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced”
Reviews.Author: SOARES1
Reviews.Content: Great location on Orchard Road and pleasant breakfast atmosphere ... Access to hotel unusual and poor. Hotel overpriced for Singapore standard properties. House-keeping too found lacking and towels worn out. Can get better for the same price range. Casual approach displayed by Duty Managers on comments. No considerations either thereafter.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Quieter section of Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: mrken22
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very strange taxi and car pick up/drop off area located on the second floor with a shopping mall underneath which you pass through if walking out of the hotel on to Orchard Road. The little shopping mall has some simple shops and is a lttle tatty compared to the glitzy malls further up the road but its not as sleazy as some other reviewers have indicated. That said it does dampen the wow factor you might expect to have when you enter a 5 star hotel. The place is undergoing refurbishment but I wasnt aware of too much drilling noise during the day. The executive floor rooms are already modernised and pleasant but the older bathrooms seem to have remained and there did not appear to be anyway to control the airconditioning apart from off or on. It seemed old and much noiser than expected. The executive lounge was quiet for breakfast but I suspect a better choice was available in the main restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,rooms,staff and service”
Reviews.Author: bonnie059
Reviews.Content: We were only there for two nights but during that time we found everthing to our expectations and were treated like VIPs. The only downside would be the entrance to the hotel , which is difficult to locate if you didnt know exactly where it was. I would certainly stay there again. Brian Besant. Tathra Australia

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressive Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mkeiller
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the Concorde prior to moving to Bintan. Front Desk staff very friendly and helpful. As for the restaurant staff, they were amognst the friendliest I have ever experienced. I have two very young children and they doted over them for the duration of the meal and nothing was too much trouble. The rooms were clean, comfortable and the beds were very wide but not that long (my feet stuck over the end). The swimming pool on the 4th floor was totally under-used by the hotel patrons which was good news for us because it is a brilliant facility and our kids loved it as did I. Two sour points - the refurbishment of the floor above us and the noise generated by it, especially during the day when we tried to put our children down for an afternoon nap. However, one phone call to reception soon put paid to it. 2) Not pram friendly when you try to get to Orchard Road through the shopping centre, no matter what route you take there are steps to negotiate which is a pain. Overall, an extremely impressive and friendly hotel and I would recommend it to anyone, especially those with young children.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and great service”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravellers91
Reviews.Content: Spent a lovely 6 nights at the Concorde. Very impressed with the front counter service, conceirge, valets and having a second maid cleaning service in the evening was excellent. Rooms were clean and tidy and giant king sized bed very comfortable. Room service meals were brilliant and by far the best room service meal we've ever had. Great location and easy to get to and from the hotel by taxi. Pedestrian access is a bit awkward, but once you get the hang of the elevators, its not a major problem. Also found one of the best Chinese massuers in the shopping complex under the hotel and the food court was always good for a quick snack/dinner. All in all, a great holiday and would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: seasonedporthopper
Reviews.Content: To be fair, this hotel has a lot going for it in terms of location and therefore convenience. However, there are so many let down points that I was left thinking 'why not go elsewhere?'. So I did. After an awfully tiresome dispute with the rude staff, I moved to the Elizabeth Hotel just down the road- exceptional value by the way, but lets get back to The Concorde. Don't be sucked in by the hotel's boasts of a central location as there are loads of better hotels for the same money all along Orchard Road. I booked for a weeks stay and wasn't advised that they were undergoing extensive renovations and therefore there would disruptions to normal service. A minor problem, but a niggle nevertheless as it became the standard excuse for all their shortcomings. I went to great lengths to establish that the rooms had a WI FI capacity and was assured that they did (this is essential as I need it to Skype my contacts back home in privacy and comfort- something I explained and something which can't be done in the lobby). Mine didn't. It was late evening when I discovered this and so I telephoned the number for the Business Centre downstairs only to be informed that internet access is limited and can be accessed AT GREAT COST and via an ethernet cable (they wanted around $40 singapore dollars for a hi speed connection per day! This was irrelevant as I had an iphone, not a laptop; a fact that the receptionist was aware of). I resolved to take this up with reception in the morning, along with a list of other things that I had been misinformed about. These were: the fact that i'd booked a smoking room but in actual fact, the hotel has a no smoking policy; my 'double' room was actually two single beds and the housekeeping standards left a lot to be desired- was I actually paying four-star prices for this circus?! The following morning and after a disappointing breakfast buffet, I went to reception to speak to the lovely lady who had given such a gross misrepresentation of my dingy room when I booked in the day before. Having worked in the service industry myself, I took great care not to be confrontational or rude, so instead I calmly laid out my issues. I thought there would at least be a basic level of customer service. Wrong. Her plastic smile quickly morphed into what must surely have been the devil incarnate and she went from unhelpful and obtuse to just plain hostile. She began raising her voice and shouting over the top of me, proclaiming her innocence and admonishing me for not having checked the room first (I had a quick scan behind me to see if there was a dog in the room, but no, she was actually talking to me). I'm sorry, but i didn't realize that we weren't supposed to trust the word of hotel receptionists now days! The real trouble came when I asked her to either relocate me to a better room or upgrade me or discount my bill (at least offer some compensation to an unhappy customer). Her perfect english had vanished and could now fail to even qualify as pidgin english as she began a shameless and ignorant display of surly behavior, akin to the worst teenage strop one could imagine- she even turned her back and walked away as I was trying to remonstrate with her! That has to be the worst customer service I've ever seen and I was made to feel utterly embarrassed. At least I think that was her intention- instead I''d say I was left bemused by it all. Needless to say that i checked out there and then. If you want a cheaper yet far superior room and hotel, go to the Elizabeth. Avoid the Concorde at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ag78
Reviews.Content: We had a deluxe room with a nice view. Room was clean and comfortable, bigger than we expected. They were renovating the lobby at the time we were there, but it didn't bother us at all. This hotel is very nicely located on Orchard Road if you like shopping etc.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: suzie1902
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Condorde Hotel for three nights in total in June 2009 and it was absolutely brilliant. The staff were always so friendly and personable - it was wonderful! Special mentions to two of our favourite staff members, Manzoor and Sharon - always so welcoming, it was such a pleasure. I would recommend anyone to stay at this hotel, not only for it's fantastic location (right on Orchard Road) but more importantly for it's exceptional service that they provide to their customers. I will definitely be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Myna-san
Reviews.Content: Whenever we go out for our annual holiday, both myself and my husband, prefer to split our holiday plan into 2-3 hotels averaging abt 2-3 days each. This gives us the opportunity to see more hotels and experience their services. Also helps us to see pretty good/ expensive hotels coupled with pretty decent ones, thereby helping average out our hotel budget. Also breaks monotony of staying in a single hotel for a long period over a week. Chose Le Meridien despite reading reviews on tripadvisor and decided to give it a shot. Our check-in itself was nothing less than a show-down. We had asked for a Kingsized bed in a non smoking room and were told that they have a queen sized bed in a smoking room. The option was shabbily left on us whether we would want to stay/ leave. Since we had already paid for all the intended nights, we stayed put on the smelly floor. The room furniture was very bad, probably never changed in its lifetime. The room had a very old CTV and the essentials were just about okay. The hotel may have been good enough in good old days but not anymore. A walk down the Orchard Road would let them knowof thye service standards required to earn the extra buck and recommendation from their guests. Avoid!

Reviews.Title: “very good location”
Reviews.Author: vtbn
Reviews.Content: it's good location . The room was clean but not so nice.All staffs were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not without faults”
Reviews.Author: markymark69Sydney
Reviews.Content: The Concorde is well located on Orchard Rd and there are subway stations nearby to make getting around easy. The staff are polite and appear to be trying hard to please everyone. The food stalls in the basement and in the nearby streets are very handy and great value. The pool was great and underutilized while I was there. The shopping mall that you have to traverse to get in and out of the hotel is a bit dreary but has plenty of massage places and karaoke bars if you are after that kind of thing. However, the foyer was like a construction zone while I was there, and only half the lifts were operating due to a major electrical drama. This is no ones fault, and makes no difference to your experience in your room, but did detract from what otherwise appeared to be a lovely foyer with a grand piano and bar. There were also a few problems while I was there with the servicing of my room and an apparent shortage of clean towells on a few occasions. There were no major dramas but these faults did make you feel like you were staying in a lesser quality hotel. I must add that I was staying in the unrenovated part of the hotel, and noise from the adjoining room was quite noticable.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous*****”
Reviews.Author: Pavimomo
Reviews.Content: On arrival first impression about this Hotel, excelent service, courtesy and professional way handling guess Room is really superb, clean very impressed, elegant and I love it. Premier lounge service is superb, feel comfortable with the services provided by all specified below. Spices Cafe service is marvelous, many dinner occasion services was great provided by all specified below. .

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Patricia088
Reviews.Content: The Concord Hotel is a friendly, clean hotel where nothing is too much of a problem for the staff. Beds and pillows are comfortable. We were three fussy elderly women who were given every assistance without having to ask for either info or help and were advised of tour desk etc . Taxis called to hotel by concierge...Private Airport transfers no problem no problem for the gracious staff to arrange. My two sisters and I would recomend the buffet breakfast. where the staff anticipate your needs..ie; make you fresh toast and bring more butter and refill your coffee all without having to be asked.. Evening drinks and nibbles or coffee in foyer accompanied by a pianist each evening An atogether most pleasant three nights. The tariff was more than reasonable and the service was most excellent. I would have no hesitation in recommending the Concorde Hotel to either my family or business assosiates

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Friendly Staff.”
Reviews.Author: Imzoyo
Reviews.Content: We reached singapore on 17th Aprill till 25th April with our two daughters aged 5&1-1/2. Hotel staff is courteous and they took care of us in terms of expediting our check in process. we were given Room 655 as per my request of NON SMOKING room. The room was orchard road facing with a nice view. The hotel is undergiong refurbishment process, The only problem we faced that the room was too close to the elevators, Soemtime people getting in and out of elevators laughing and talking loud in the middle of the night made me wake up in the middle of the night. I requested room change which was promptly handled and they show us other available rooms. But then i decide to stay in the same. Our stay was for 7 days, they provide us a nice complimentry baby cot. Internet chages are high, Breakfast was great, Spice Restaruant staff was quite professional and courtious. They have Swimming pool at 4th floor along with gym and a tiny pool for kids which my kids enjoyed alot, They have Doctors Clinic beside the gym and the doctor is availabe from 8am till 11am, we had to consult the doctor because our younger daughter developed fever, Doctor examine her very well and prescribe good medicines which worked really well. Getting in and out from hotel is a tricky business because there is no direct access to hotel lobby, Overall it was a pleasent experience to stay with Concorde Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Singapore Trip with Concorde Hotel's marvelous services!”
Reviews.Author: CaringMama
Reviews.Content: Our visit to Singapore in May 2009 was made more exciting by the comfort provided by the Corcorde Hotel. Every member of the staff approaches you with utmost courtesy and charm. Our stay at Rm. 835 for 4D and 3N was so satisfying, enough for us to have our much needed rest for the next days' busy schedules. Our daughters enjoyed every food tasted in a buffet breakfast at the resto located at the hotel's ground floor. You wouldn't need a tour guide as you can have travel maps available from the airport and the hotel as well. From the hotel, you won't mind walking about 600m to the nearest MRT station (Dhoby Ghaut) because of the wide and clean road. Aside from what you see on travel guides, you shouldn't miss the Singapore Flyer, Creatures of the Night Show at the Night Safari, Songs of the Sea at the Sentosa, Eating time of the Polar Bear, and the Splash Show at Singapore Zoo. We took a Mercedes Benz cab, from the hotel towards Singapore Zoo for about SGD40 and rode back on an ordinary blue Comfort cab for about SGD20. Also, don't forget to redeem your 7% Goods and Services Tax at the airport on your way back home. For every SGD100 or more of your purchases, ask a GST invoice from your merchant and present it to the Customs official at the airport, together with the purchased item. We were able to redeem about SGD100 for a purchased Laptop. In totality, the Singaporeans are courteous and environment-friendly people.

Reviews.Title: “A bit tired, great service, good location - great value for money”
Reviews.Author: tartanryan
Reviews.Content: Visited Concorde Singapore for 3 nights for a stop-off on my way back to the UK. Booked through expedia who were offering a good deal for 3 night stays. The hotel has recently changed it's name but used to be Le Meridian, Singapore. The new owners appear to me on a mission to improve standards across the board. The hotel is access from Orchard Rd through a shopping centre which is a bit tired and down market and the lift used to access the hotel starts you worrying as it's pretty grim but panic not, once you reach the lobby, the hotel recovers just fine. It's worth a few pounds extra to upgrade to an executive room which gives you a complimentary breakfast and access to the executive lounge. Check-in was very good with an excellent explanation of hotel facilities, dining etc. The member of staff was very friendly and welcoming. The room was good with loads of space. The bathroom was huge! Only negatives were a poor shower fitting (not good for anyone above 5.5ft) and some dated equipment and fittings. There was also limited storage space and hangers in the wardrope. The executive lounge was great and the lounge hosts were extremely friendly and attentive (special mention to Bernadette who is a star!!). Each evening complimentary snacks, cocktails, beers, wine & spirits were provided. There is also a PC with internet access in the lounge for guest use. Well worth the upgrade. Use the gym which is well equipped but very tired. I put this on the comment card when I checked out and was surprised to receive a letter when I was back in the UK from the general manager of the hotel advising the gym is to be refurbished in the next quarter so this hotel does take the time to listen and respond to guests. Breakfast in the main restaurant is also good but be prepared to wait to be seated at the busiest times as this hotel seems to be used by tour groups who tend to eat at the same time. Would definitely recommend and will return when I am next in Singapore. This hotel is only going to improve with the present management & owners.

Reviews.Title: “Choose somewhere else!!”
Reviews.Author: JenB78
Reviews.Content: Concorde was a big disappointment! We stayed in deluxe interconnecting rooms - (not as yet updated) with our three teenage children. Apart from restaurant everything is dated and tired. Staff (except in restaurant) were not particularly interested in helping or ensuring your stay was a good one. Room was spacious but very tired - carpet needs updating, furnishings are very dated and shabby. Bathroom was not particularly clean with the last guest's hair still in the sink and bath- was not a good start. Requests to staff at reception were ignored - and I wouldn't say we were particularly demanding travellers. Breakfast was also a disappointment - dishes often empty and not refilled quickly, soggy items, bacon blackened 3 mornings running, juices and fruit uninviting. All rooms our situated around a central "courtyard" - so any noise from the reception area comes straight up to your room - we were woken on the first morning by squealing children waiting downstairs. Location on Orchard Rd is good and only a short walk to train station, bus stop is at front of hotel and tourist info centre is a block down Orchard Rd. However, to get from street level to your room means a flight of stairs, a lift to lobby level, then change to another lift to get to room level - this does get a bit of a pain and not all the lifts were working so it sometimes took up to 10 minutes to get from Orchard Rd to your room. Holiday Inn Park View is directly behind the Concorde so would have all the same benefits of location but may be worth considering instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: MaMo10
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the hotel during a business trip. The hotel is located on Orchard street, among all the great shopping centers. I stayed at the business floor, that provided free high speed internet in the room, free WiFi in the lobby, and free usage of the business lounge. In the business lounge there are free hot and cold drinks and snacks all day long, and it offer cocktails and hot dishes during the evening. The hotel offers a very large breakfast buffet, with various kind of cuisine. I enjoyed my stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “best location, great price”
Reviews.Author: pshah19
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days and by Singapore standards rates were pretty good. The best part was the location was right on Orchard Rd which is Singapore's happening street.Orchard rd has Singapore's most upscale shopping and dining and it's especially fun to hang out on sat nights. Most of the other hotels near by were atleast twice the price.Service was great. Staff were generally helpful. Hotel also had a decent pool and gym. The rooms were spacious and maintained very well.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: whatcouldtopthis
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through expedia as there was a 40% discount on the stay and the location on Orchard Rd was what we were after as we hadn't visited Singapore before. Room was clean and comfortable. No complaints. Hawker centre outside on the corner was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janulik
Reviews.Content: This hotel looked lovely during Christmas time with Santa hats on the top of the elevators, rooms were small but very clean and staff friendly. The only thing was that you have to go through a little shopping mall to get to the reception and the MRT is not that close...but still walkable distance.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: srnd
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious and clean even if the hotel looks a bit dated. We were welcomed by friendly staff and were offered a drink when we check in. Staff were most courteous and always happy to help us, answer our questions or find out info for us. The hotel is perfectly situated just 2 minutes away from MRT station (tube) with lots of shops and places to eat around. Pity that breakfast is not included and a bit overpriced, but we can find many restaurants and cafes to eat anywhere in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “When family came together again.....”
Reviews.Author: Promila B
Reviews.Content: Me, my husband and my son have extremely busy lives of our own back home so we decided to take a break and try to experience the bond once again that we had years back.... what a right choice we made to go to Singapore the city that has so much to offer and then our travel agent helped us get this beautiful hotel that had everything that helped us enjoy our trip multi-folds. The accommodation is absolutely centrally located, all the attractions of singapore were max SG$7-8 away... it is situated on the main orchard road so most of the time we walked on the main road of singapore with vast number of eating joints as well as shopping stores...it was fun!! We did so much of street eating and street wandering as a family that we had not done for quite some time...... it was fabulous..... i have to singapore twice before but those were more of business trips turned into somewhat pleasure but with family we explored some fantastic restaurants at clarke quey and boat quey ...the nightlife of these two queys was an amazing experience.... the hotel added so much to our wonderful experience...the rooms were well stocked and the service was great. The reception handling was good too.... the pick-ups for the attractions points were always on time and efficient in their services...all in all, a great experience and time we had.....

Reviews.Title: “what old fashion serves was like and was at this hotle”
Reviews.Author: concorde7
Reviews.Content: We arrived at hotel 7am long flight Perth 0.15 am Mon to Singapore on Jetstar arrive at around 6am.Taxi to hotel and asked if we could leave cases at hotel while we waited for check in ,the man on the desk said we could have an early book it if we liked .I asked to change money no problem no charge .Need a tour there is a tour desk in the hotel .All round good service .

Reviews.Title: “Totally lacking...”
Reviews.Author: B777av8r
Reviews.Content: After transiting across the world, I was given a suite. At first things appeared quite nice, except I require internet for business purposes. There is no wireless in the rooms, so there is ethernet. The system did not function and after 30 minutes of discussion with every technical wizard somewhere in this Asian world, it was decided that the 'system had failed'. On to room # 2. Same style of refurbished room. As I walked down the hallway, I could smell the pungent scent of BLACK MOLD...not good. I entered the room and it was very warm and very humid. I thought that the air conditioning had not been turned on. I was wrong. It was going full cold, but there was water running down the wall on one side of the ducting and on the other side...HOT air was pouring out. I was so tired by this time, I accepted this room. I should have persevered and moved again immediately. Next morning...room # 3, where everything worked well. The breakfasts were included in the room. I've seen a lot better and for the price that you pay, you'd expect a lot more. Not good value. The hotel is next to the Red Light District...yes, its legal here...there is a 'pickup bar' down stairs in part of the shopping plaza. In the evening, the 'girls' are hanging around some of the hallways. The MRT (transit) is conveniently close. Dhouby Ghout station is about 10 minutes away and will get you away from the area. There is a trendy set of restaurants about 5 minutes from here which makes up the area called: Cuppage. Not too bad. Overall...not a great hotel. It needs a lot of work. I like fittness centers...this one SUCKS...the treadmills are worn out, as is the carpet.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: lilylaila
Reviews.Content: my family stayed at this hotel for five days- we booked two rooms and arrived before noon.We were pleasantly surprised that our rooms were ready and we were given rooms with balcony which was great.Spacious rooms,free bottled water daily,8 cocktail glasses in each room( which saves frequent washing)and two regular sized mugs(unlike most hotels which only provide cup and saucer). comfortable beddings.lots of storage ,ironing facilities,great view facing the swimming pool.Housekeeping services excellent-even came to our room in the evening to ask if we need extra towels(we were staying with children)separate towels available beside the pool .Great spacious lobby.All staff from reception,conscierge,cleaners were friendly.check in & check out were fast.Staff at all level seemed to be poractive and had tremendous initiatives.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel.Great staff.Great location”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda33
Reviews.Content: Really nice, comfortable hotel.Very friendly, well-trained staff (nothing too much trouble) Convenient restaurant - great buffet breakfasts. Undergoing refurbishment.we had an unrefurbished room which was still very nice. This hotel can be booked from the Hotel desk at Changi airport at very good savings (which we found out after arrival!)

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneTraveller2
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 days at the Concorde Hotel and thoroughly enjoyed it. Our room was spacious and well appointed, with everything you could need including an ironing board and iron, complimentary bottled water each day, and guest slippers. The hotel lobby is very impressive and we enjoyed listening to the grand piano being played each evening. Spices Cafe is recently refurbished and has excellent meals at a reasonable price. Service at the hotel is first rate. The location of the hotel is super convenient, being at the start of the Orchard Road shopping. We booked three tours through the tour desk and they all left from the hotel and were great value. As mentioned by others, pedestrian access is through a shopping arcade which will possibly be upgraded in the future as the hotel rooms are being gradually refurbished. The food court in the shopping centre was quite good and there is a hawker centre nearby that had a great variety of food. We will definately stay at the Concorde Hotel on future trips to Singapore. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Access to Good Reasonable Clean Food.”
Reviews.Author: ching17
Reviews.Content: Hotel looby is on the 3rd flr. First 2 floors with food and service stalls. The first 2 floors look pretty shabby. But the food sold are good and cheap. Hotel room is ok. Clean. Hotel allowed us to check in at 10a.m. and check out at 2p.m. with no extra charge. Overall good. Except that we feel the rates should have been cheaper. But overall our 2 nights stay here was satisfying.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Staff, service, and amenities”
Reviews.Author: Love2travelAustralia
Reviews.Content: I would like to compliment the Concorde Hotel on their attention to detail, and their service and warm, helpful staff. My Husband and I stayed at this Hotel in February this year, and we were both very impressed with the facilities and with the upgrade that we received upon booking in. We stayed on the 9th floor, and had a beautiful room, which has apparently recently been refurbished. There were robes and slippers for us to use, iron and ironing board, jug, mini fridge, an umbrella of all things, and being given the upgrade, free use of their Executive Lounge daily. We could have tea/coffee/soft drinks/cookies, water/ use their laptops, have cocktails and nibblies every night, which we never did get to, as there was too much else to do. We paid for the breakfast to be included in our price of the room, and it was certainly worth it. There was enough food there to sink a ship, and you really didn't need lunch at all.The staff were super friendly every morning, and the service was spot on. You could choose a hot breakfast - eggs, bacon, sausage, croissants, pancakes,waffles,toast, baked beans, cereal, juice, tea/cofffee, and an assortment of other food which I never did get around to eating. One morning I had a coughing fit, and I was instantly handed a glass of water and a handful of serviettes from two of the staff. In Australia, they would just watch you choke!!!! The pool was to die for. I usually spent some time every day doing laps. The plan was to actually go to the gym, but it was too hot, so I swam instead. Someone had to do it. I think I was a disappointment to the staff serving drinks and lunch, as I only ever asked for a glass of iced water,never food. The lounger chairs each had two towels for you to use, and umbrellas, as well as tables and chairs under cover for dining. Another bonus with the room was two bottles of water per day for our use. We usually put those into our fridge, and took out the cold bottles every day. There is also tea and coffee as well as sugar which is refilled every day. I took my own coffee and tea bags and sugar, as I hate running out, and also I wasn't sure what type of tea they would have. My Husband accidentally dropped his mobile as we were getting out of the taxi as we arrived, and when we noticed it was missing, we called down to the front desk. Luckily one of the staff had handed it in, and when we described it, the phone was delivered to our room. We had some paperwork to fill out, and our peace of mind was restored. We had a night arrival, which was actually good, so our body clocks weren't messed up. We were also given fresh orange juice as we were waiting to book in. The day of departure, we had a late flight home, so we were offered a late book out, 3pm I think, and we had the offer of a shower room before we left for the airport. Being soooooooooo hot in Singapore, I spent the afternoon in the pool, after our marathon shopping expedition downtown, and we asked for the shower room, where we freshened up before our flight home. Overall, we couldn't have been happier with our stay. Downstairs, and out the front of the Hotel, there are stalls with souvenirs, and beware of the Camera shop, where my Husband seemed to keep getting stuck in. Actually the shop owner was very nice, and must have been extremely happy with my Husband's continuous visists. There is also a tour desk, where we booked the Zoo, Sentosa Island, and a city tour. The buses leave from downstairs at the back of the hotel, access is down the escalators. My Husband and I were the only ones booked for the Zoo, so we had the driver to ourselves, which was great. Be warned about the Elephants' bath time. Very smelly!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I don't think I need explain any further. We also had breakfast with the Orangatans, and our driver took us to a table where we had a wonderful view of them.We were so close we cold almost touch them. If you are going to Singapore in the near future, my Husband and I would definitely recommend a stay at the Concorde Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Canboy
Reviews.Content: Clean and newly renovated old hotel. Going in to the hotel is not convinient. You have to pass thru a (not so nice) mall and take the elevator to the lobby which is on the 3rd floor. And then you need to transfer to another elevator to go to your room. The room size is ok. Bed is too soft for me.
